thread.title: Football Roundup: Brittingham leads NCC past Glascock
thread.title_full: Football Roundup: Brittingham leads NCC past Glascock

author: MDJ staff reports (noreply@mdjonline.com)
title: Football Roundup: Brittingham leads NCC past Glascock
text: Football Roundup: Brittingham leads NCC past Glascock by MDJ staff reports The Marietta Daily Journal  26 AM | 366 views | 0 | 3 | | David Brittingham rushed for 146 yards and scored four touchdown and led North Cobb Christian to its second straight victory with a 52-7 win at Glascock County on Friday. Brittingham scored on a 41-yarder to cap the Eagles’ first drive of the game, but Glascock County (0-7) responded with a touchdown to tie it at 7-all. North Cobb Christian (4-2) took over from there, with 45 unanswered points. “We have to give a lot of the credit to the defense,” coach Scott Ryle said. “They did a good job shutting down (Glascock’s offense), and our offensive line is doing a heck of a job. The last game we won, we had to come back and win so I said that we’ve got to start from the get-go.” North Cobb Christian’s offensive line created big enough gaps for Brittingham to score two more first-quarter touchdowns. Tim Walker also had a touchdown on a 40-yard run, and the Eagles added a field goal to take a 31-7 lead before the first quarter expired. Jaylen Dampier threw a 6-yard touchdown pass to Sean Horgan to give the Eagles a 38-7 halftime lead. Brittingham scored his fourth touchdown of the game from 23 yards out on North Cobb Christian’s first drive of the second half, before he was pulled out of the game.Santino Corpora capped the scoring on a 20-yard touchdown run in the fourth quarter.North Cobb Christian totaled 440 yards of offense. Dampier was 9-of-13 passing for 119 yards.The Eagles, two games above .500 for the first time in team history, will face their third straight lengthy road trip when they travel to the Savannah area for a game with New Hampstead (5-2) on Friday.► Shiloh Hills Christian 62, Hearts Academy 6: The visiting Challengers jumped to a 32-0 first-quarter lead and never let up. Its offense produced big plays in the first quarter to set the tone. James Lewis had a 20-yard run for a touchdowns, Jonny Jenkins had 34-yard run for touchdown and Jordan Ratliff caught a 37-yard touchdown pass.Shiloh Hills (3-2) cruised from there. Jenkins also scored on a 75-yard interception return. Ratliff had two catches for 53 yards and two touchdowns. Shane Lewis had nine tackles and scored on a 16-yard run, while Jenkins had 10 rushes for 110 yards and two interceptions on defense. Shiloh Hills will host People’s Academy on Friday.
